title: (x) 70s title/logo serif face w/ swashes on Tarragon sweatshirt - Bookman Swash {Patricia}
content:
I’m trying to identify the logo used for the word “Tarragon” in this picture (a scan of a sweatshirt). I’ve found lots of similar fonts, but nothing quite right. I suspect that the “r” alternates may have been hand-drawn.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907033519im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/tarragon-font_5717.jpg)

The logo dates from around the early to mid-70s, I believe, so hopefully that helps!

Thanks in advance ...

 [‹ Slightly squooshed Art Deco geometric sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907033519/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40013 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Debaser" extremely black sans w/ filled counters- Geist RND {Rainer} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907033519/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39997 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cviebrock

comments.content: That most certainly seems to be it ... thanks!

Just an addendum: [Bookman Complete](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907033519/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085) is digitally available at veer.com. With all the swishy swashy, created by Jason Walcott and based on the original designs of Alexander C. Phemister and Chauncey H. Griffith

Meanwhile - THE THEATRE was set in Souvenir Demibold - if anyone wanted to know  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-souvenir/demi/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907033519/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-souvenir/demi/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-souvenir/demi/")
